title: How A Single Town In Syria Became A Symbol Of The War Against ISIS
teaser: Now that Kurdish fighters have retaken the Syrian border town of Kobani from ISIS, the Obama administration is assessing the significance of the development. For months, officials suggested the town was of little strategic significance even as warplanes bombed targets day after day.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
